items.sentence: Tom couldn't remember what he'd been talking about.
That tree over there is a lot taller than this one.
I don't think I'll be allowed to do that by myself.
Do you think Tom answered those questions honestly.
I don't know why I agreed to go in the first place.
I don't always understand everything you're saying.
I'd like you to close the door when you go outside.
I tried to make sure that everyone was entertained.
I feel like today is going to be one of those days.
I often listen to soothing music in order to relax.
I was woken up by the noise of the traffic outside.
I think it's going to get steadily hotter from now.
I just want you to know how much I appreciate this.
The blue toothbrush is Tom's. The red one's Mary's.
What reasons would Tom have for doing such a thing?
I don't think that Tom knows why I don't like Mary.
I think everyone here knows that Tom can't do that.
How often did you do that when you were a teenager?
I've been studying French for the past three years.
Did you know that Tom wanted to become a carpenter?
